abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton brings her presidential campaign to South Carolina, state she lost to Barack Obama in 2008 in defeat tinged with racial overtones; Clinton, who has long drawn support of black voters, avoids discussion of race, focusing instead on helping women and middle class; Clinton also emphasizes her steady support of Obama following 2008 loss.
lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton, a Democrat running for president, was in Columbia, S.C., where she spoke to African-Americans about her support for the president and her own plans should she be elected in 2016.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton, in South Carolina, Reminds Black Women of Her Support for Obama
headline.print_headline: Clinton, in South Carolina, Reminds Black Women of Her Support for Obama

snippet: Mrs. Clinton, a Democrat running for president, was in Columbia, S.C., where she spoke to African-Americans about her support for the president and her own plans should she be elected in 2016.
